page.title: 18SIDDINGTON'S RIDING STABLES
page.content: On the NE edge of Siddington Village is the Talland School of Equitation. The school's horses,kept in 52 loose boxes and stalls have the use of 42.5 hectares of near by fields leased from Lord Bathurst.In Summer many horses live in these fields.During this time pupils attend courses in the dressage and jumping arenas,two covered riding areas and on the cross-country course. Overseas and long stay students are boarded with local families,at Church Farm or at Talland House.Many local children and adults learn to ride here too all year round.The cost is Â£3.45 per hour.There are pony helpers and 4 instructors.Students are expected,as part of their training,to look after their own ponies.Children are asked to join the Pony Club and join in such events as gymkhana rallies and hunting for this is V.W.H country.
